text: rhubarb is only around for about six
weeks
so I say when it's in season use it
often and use it liberally here I've
blended it into a cool and creamy shake
the first thing that I like to do is
just make it into a compote because once
you have this in the fridge you can use
it for anything you can just spoon it
over ice cream or yogurt or just eat it
straight smaller the pieces more quickly
it will cook and then you just need to
add a little bit of liquid I'm gonna add
water in this case but you could also
add orange juice or apple juice and
usually I add honey to taste but because
I know that this is destined for a sweet
shake I'm gonna add a lot of honey when
you're shopping for rhubarb if you can
buy the reddest stalks you can find
you're gonna end up with the prettiest
compote so this will take about maybe 10
minutes to break down basically it looks
like pink apple sauce that's what I'm
gonna add the rosewater rosewater and
rhubarb goes so well together but you
just want to add a little bit and you
want to add it at the end because the
more you heat rosewater the more its
perfume dissipate go slow because it can
be very intense then you want to just
taste it make sure that there's enough
honey enough rosewater and that's
perfect it has a little bit of a Tang
but not too much so this is my rhubarb
compote I have let it chill in the
fridge so it's nice and cold by the way
this is only a portion of what I made
the rest of it is going on yogurt for
breakfast everything could go into the
blender at the same time by the way if
you could only find kind of greenish
rhubarb you can throw a few strawberries
in there nobody will notice and I'll
look really pretty in the shake and now
I've got Greek yogurt I'm using the full
fat stuff here but you could use the
non-fat the low fat depends on how rich
you want this and then ice
and then when it's smooth you just want
to taste it got to do this several times
during the process very important to
keep tasting mmm this tastes good to me
but this is very much a drink of season
to taste so if you think it needs a
little more honey or a little more
rosewater go ahead and now you just want
to serve it you have to make sure
they're even so nobody fights garnish
them with strawberries and then I'm just
gonna put a little bit of pistachio on
the top both for color and because
pistachios go so well with rhubarb and
rosewater if you didn't know it you will
just have to try it to see you could
serve this as a snack but I like it for
dessert
all
